meta_description: The Newport Mansions offers a unique trip through 250 years of American history, architecture, art and landscape design.
hours_text:
## Open Properties

Operating schedule is subject to change

## [The Breakers](http://web.archive.org/web/20260102141058/https://www.newportmansions.org/mansions-and-gardens/the-breakers/)

Open today 9:00am – 5:00pm

The Breakers is the grandest of Newport's summer "cottages" and a symbol of the Vanderbilt family's social and financial pre-eminence in the Gilded Age.

Open daily except Thanksgiving & Christmas Day

## [Marble House](http://web.archive.org/web/20260102141058/https://www.newportmansions.org/mansions-and-gardens/marble-house/)

Closed today

William Vanderbilt built Marble House as a 39th birthday present for his wife, Alva. It was a social and architectural landmark that set the pace for Newport's subsequent transformation from a quiet summer colony of wooden houses to the legendary resort of opulent Gilded Age mansions.

Open daily except Thanksgiving & Christmas Day

## [The Elms](http://web.archive.org/web/20260102141058/https://www.newportmansions.org/mansions-and-gardens/the-elms/)

Open today 9:00am – 5:00pm

The Elms was modeled after an 18th-century French chateau but featured the latest technology of the Gilded Age. It houses an outstanding collection of paintings, statuary and tapestries, and its landscape features formal gardens, terraces, pavilions and fountains.

Open daily except Thanksgiving & Christmas Day

## [Rosecliff](http://web.archive.org/web/20260102141058/https://www.newportmansions.org/mansions-and-gardens/rosecliff/)

Closed today

collections_text:
## Things to Do

Guide-led Tour at  The Breakers

10 am every day

##  [Beneath The Breakers Tour](http://web.archive.org/web/20260116113742/https://newportmansion.wpengine.com/events/beneath-the-breakers/)

Below The Breakers was a marvel of Gilded Age technology. Through a guide-led tour, see the boiler room, tunnel and basement, and learn how daily life was transformed by new wonders. Advance ticket purchase suggested.

Guide-led Tour at  The Elms

12 pm on Fridays, Saturdays & Sundays

##  [Servant Life Tour](http://web.archive.org/web/20260116113742/https://www.newportmansions.org/events/servant-life-tour/)

Hear the stories of some of the men and women who worked to service the social whirl of Newport during the Gilded Age, and see the hidden areas where they worked.

Guide-led Tour at  The Breakers

2 pm every day

##  [The Breakers Third Floor Preservation in Progress Tour](http://web.archive.org/web/20260116113742/https://www.newportmansions.org/events/the-breakers-third-floor/)

For the first time in the 129-year history of The Breakers, the private third-floor family space occupied by generations of Vanderbilts is open for public tours.

[View all upcoming events, programs, exhibitions](/web/20260116113742/https://www.newportmansions.org/events)
